examples.jmarkov

Class ErlangQueue

  • java.lang.Object
    • jmarkov.MarkovProcess<S,E>
      • jmarkov.SimpleMarkovProcess<GeomState<Sub>,E>

  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    JMarkovElement

    public class ErlangQueue
extends GeomProcess<examples.jmarkov.ErlangQueueState,examples.jmarkov.ErlangQueueEvent>
    This class implements a system with N servers with erlang services.

    • Method Detail

      • active

        public boolean active(examples.jmarkov.ErlangQueueState i,
             int iLevel,
             examples.jmarkov.ErlangQueueEvent e)
        Description copied from class: GeomProcess
        The user must extend this method to determine which events are active.
        Specified by:
        active in class GeomProcess<examples.jmarkov.ErlangQueueState,examples.jmarkov.ErlangQueueEvent>
        Parameters:
        i - the current sub state
        iLevel - Absolute level of current State i. You should test only whether it is 0 (boundary), 1 or greater than 1. Your code should not behave any different if the level is 2, or 3, etc
        e - The event being tested.
        Returns:
        tru if this event occurs

      • dests

        public GeomRelState<examples.jmarkov.ErlangQueueState>[] dests(examples.jmarkov.ErlangQueueState i,
                                                      int absLevel,
                                                      examples.jmarkov.ErlangQueueEvent e)
        Description copied from class: GeomProcess
        Determines the destination set of States when events e occurs. It has to be implemented by the subclass.
        Specified by:
        dests in class GeomProcess<examples.jmarkov.ErlangQueueState,examples.jmarkov.ErlangQueueEvent>
        Parameters:
        i - current State.
        absLevel - absolute level of current State. For QBD this is 0, 1 or 2. Anything above 2 should report the same result.
        e - The Event that ocurred.
        Returns:
        The destination States

        jLevel - destination level

      • description

        public java.lang.String description()
        Description copied from class: MarkovProcess
        This method should be implemented by the subclass to give word description of the model. For example it should say: Queueing system with 2 servers and exponential arrivals with rate 50 per hour.
        Specified by:
        description in interface JMarkovElement
        Specified by:
